intro: Enkianthus deflexus, commonly known as the drooping enkianthus, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its clusters of bell-shaped flowers that range from white to pink, blooming in early spring. Its leaves are elliptical and have a glossy texture, providing ornamental value throughout the growing season. Enkianthus deflexus is often cultivated for its aesthetic appeal and ability to thrive in acidic, well-drained soils.
